attributes.action: compel the so-called Phoenix consortium (messrs Towers, Stephenson, Beale and Edwards together with chief executive Kevin Howe) to create a special pension fund (value £14.7m) for the benefit of the 6,500 workers made redundant due to the collapse of MG Rover. This fund to be administered pro bono by Barclays’ Capital and overseen by the DTI.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This action is to help towards compensating the 6,500 workers made redundant from the collapse of MG Rover. This will be at the expense of the 4 directors and chief exec who have collectively made £4.7m from the collapse of the company.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
